pros: In my opinion and my experience with St. Josephs Health Care it was the staff, plus management that made my experiences, not only enjoyable, but wanting me to do more than what was expected of me and to do my very best while on the job. All of the staff that I worked with, or dealt  with were such team members it made my job so much easier. It was a great place to be employed and I will truly miss it.
cons: The only con that I can honestly think of is having to pay to park to go to your place of employment, but I guess that is to be expected in todays world.

pros: It is a very friendly place to work, like one big family. Staff are very helpful towards the patients, I  walk the halls all day for my job. I talk to the patients the reviews they have for St. Josephs hospital are very positive.
cons: Never enough staff is a big problem, its all about budgets. This can be very frustrating.

review_title: Work front line with adolescents population. Support and run therapeutic groups for clients experiencing mental health

pros: Great pay, great co-workers,  meaningful work with clients. Ft employees receive benefits and vacation time. Unionized worker.
cons: Micromanage style management. Often working short staffed and in unsafe conditions. Front line assessment not always considered.

review_title: It has it's ups and downs
job_title: Primary Care Partner in London, ON
pros: Great pay, with good benefits, lots of room to move around to different sites to change it up within your job classification.
cons: Takes forever to get full time, very little staff appreciation, being in the public sector get used to very little if any wage increases.
